item.title: The tool that really runs your containers: deep dive into runc and OCI specifications | articles about programming on mkdev
item.description: There are many ways to run containers, all with good use cases. But there is one tool that is at the core of most of them, be it Docker, Podman or Cri-o: runc. item.title: Stuck in the Past? Scaling up Academia
item.description: A re-occurring impression about academia is how certain processes are stuck in the past, never getting re-examined. For all the progressive views academia has, we academics tend to be unwilling to change or to adopt new processes, at least for a while. item.title: What is a type system, really?
item.description: Background This is a question I've been wrestling with for a little bit. My first experience with a type system was with Java, and I didn't like it. It just felt like an annoying constraint on the kinds of programs I could write. I was coming from Perl, which sports weak dynamic typing, so Java's rigidity came as a bit of a shock. After Java I learned some C, which too has types.

item.title: Reactive programming in F#
item.description: Functional programming and reactive programming are two paradigms that, when combined, enable you to write highly responsive, composable, and predictable code.
